contentHtml: #131. What's the output? const emojis = ['🥑', ['✨', '✨', ['🍕', '🍕']]]; console.log(emojis.flat(1)); javascript A: ['🥑', ['✨', '✨', ['🍕', '🍕']]] B: ['🥑', '✨', '✨', ['🍕', '🍕']] C: ['🥑', ['✨', '✨', '🍕', '🍕']] D: ['🥑', '✨', '✨', '🍕', '🍕'] Answer Answer: B With the flat method, we can create a new, flattened array. The depth of the flattened array depends on the value that we pass. In this case, we passed the value 1 (which we didn't have to
